entry.name: Consumption Based CO2 Emission
entry.desc: greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions that are created when we consume the goods and services we buy every day

entry.name: Production Based Emission
entry.desc: Production-based emissions are equal to the sum of emissions of the six greenhouse gases targeted in the Kyoto Protocol (CO2, CH4, N20, CFK, HFK and SF6, in CO2 equivalents). This includes greenhouse gas emissions by resident companies which engage in production activities abroad (for example emissions by airlines and by seagoing and inland vessels). Direct emissions by households are excluded

entry.name: Historical Cumulative Emission
entry.desc: The term is used here to indicate annual emissions for countries from 1850 - 2019

entry.name: Extraction based Emission
entry.desc: CO2 emissions from burning fossil fuels are attributed to the country where the fuels are extracted. It can be calculated by multiplying primary energy extraction data for coal, oil and gas by location-specific (or default) carbon contents, and adjusting for the fraction of fossil fuels that are not combusted
